page.title: 08HEALTH TOFTWOOD
page.content: The letter referred to on page 7 resulted in a petition with 2,560 signatures. The local doctors based in Dereham, do not believe the building of a surgery in Toftwood is a good idea. They argue that improving transport to the two surgeries in the town is more sensible as a new surgery in Toftwood would only duplicate existing facilities in Dereham. A new surgery would cost at least Â£250,000 and the Norfolk Area Health Authority is not willing to provide money for this project in view of the medical facilities already available in the Dereham area. It is perhaps unfortunate that all medical facilities are concentrated in Dereham town centre and yet the new housing estates are being built further and further away from these facilities.
